goal.tools.mc.program.goal.prolog.trans

Class PrologAtom

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.mc.program.goal.prolog.trans.PrologAtom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Atom

    public class PrologAtom
extends java.lang.Object
implements Atom
    Represents an atom when the Prolog KRT is used.
    Author:
    sungshik.

    • Method Detail

      • affirm

        public static jpl.Term affirm(jpl.Term term)
        Affirms term, i.e. strips the not operator of a Prolog term.
        Parameters:
        term - The PrologTerm to be affirmed.
        Returns:
        The affirmed PrologTerm.

        public static PrologAtom factory(jpl.Term term)
        Constructs a PrologAtom object iff term is a Prolog atom.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isAtom

        public static boolean isAtom(jpl.Term term)
        Determines whether term is a positive atom. For this to be the case, two conditions must hold: (i) term is not a variable term, and (ii) term is not a built-in Prolog predicate.
        Parameters:
        term - The term to test.
        Returns:
        true if the two conditions are satisfied; false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • unify

        public static Substitution unify(jpl.Atom atomX,
                 jpl.Atom atomY)
        Unifies atomX and atomY. Returns the unifier if unification is successful, and null otherwise. This method is commutative.
        Parameters:
        atomX - The left-hand side.
        atomY - The right-hand side.
        Returns:
        A unifier that unifies atomX and atomY if one exists, and null otherwise.
